content: It's also possible people registered for virtual participation after that. So yes, we'll send out another email tomorrow morning. Thanks @Jorge Soto-Andrade
Thanks Kyle! Just found the message with the zoom links beneath a huge heap of unread mail ... Thanks Joe, too!
Will tutorials be streamed too?
Yes, see #conference: ACT23 > Tutorials
23578712-2D1E-47B5-B2F8-B5CEF19C8E45.jpg
Here we go, off to a great start!

A thought: might it be a good idea to create a topic for each talk that is occuring? This might cause the stream to become very crowded given the number of talks, but also would allow people to have a go-to place for questions about a talk
could someone in the room ask the speaker to face the microphone when speaking?
We’re using a lapel mic, is it problematic?
ah, okay. no its not too bad. i thought we were losing words when priyaa turns away, but maybe its the connection

Bruno Gavranović said:

A thought: might it be a good idea to create a topic for each talk that is occurring?

I think that was done in previous ACTs, and it seems like a good idea to me. Luckily anyone can easily do it here, so we don't even need the boss to do it. Anyone who has a question or comment about a talk can put it in a new thread with that talk title as subject.
And if nobody cares about some talk, it won't have a thread. :cry:
I will create a topic for each talk. Thanks for starting the first one @Aleks Kissinger.
Or, does someone want to volunteer to create topics for each talk?
I'd be happy to do it. (maybe I'll can just create topics for the first day, so it doesn't all become cluttered immediatelly)
can speaker repeat questions?
Yes we cannot hear the questions.
That's important... also the speaker's voice keeps cutting out.
So there's no way to get anyone's attention except here? E.g. Zoom chat is disabled?
(Hi Christina!)
For me the Zoom chat isn't disabled
For me it's working too
Okay, that'd be the usual place to say "HEY, CAN THE SPEAKER REPEAT QUESTIONS?"
The "Stratchlyde watching group" just did at the zoom chat!
Okay, good... I'm glad the Strathclyde watching group is watching. :eyes:
Will recordings of the talks be posted anywhere?
We're a watch party :partying_face: :tada:

Jules Hedges said:

We're a watch party :partying_face: :tada:

Haha sorry indeed
It looks like each speaker needs to enable recording on their talks? So worth collectively double checking recording has been turned on as these talks begin.
I have registered but don't seem to have a zoom link, can someone supply it?

Hi we didn’t post the links here since this channel is publicly mirrored and we don’t want zoom bombs. Can someone turn off the public mirroring of this channel perhaps? Or else make a non mirrored channel for zoom links and move this there?
sorry for the breach, i've removed the links
No probs, it would be nice to be able to post the links here though.
Hi Sam, can I ask what is the mechanism for ensuring registered participants have access to the Zoom link?
Hi they’re emailed out by @Joe Moeller every now and then. Happy to send the links by private message or email too.

I see. Yes please can you send it. The problem with sending the link every now and then is that people like me who register 30 seconds before the talk they want to watch can't get in :). You could maybe embed the link in the Eventbrite confirmation email -- just a suggestion.
Someone was asking about the abstracts. Just click the links in the programme to see them. https://act2023.github.io/programme.html
Will the group picture be posted?
